summary: Visual representations of consequences can enhance awareness and understanding, prompting individuals to reconsider harmful habits.
Tangible and vivid reminders of potential negative outcomes can motivate individuals to alter their behavior and make healthier choices.
Providing information and prompting curiosity can lead individuals to seek further knowledge, increasing their understanding of the risks associated with their actions.
Displaying the physical consequences of harmful actions can serve as a powerful deterrent, encouraging individuals to reflect on the long-term impact of their choices.
